column4: Schlaken, that appears to indicate something, not sure what but certainly something
maybe there is some problem with something in the directory
no, he has full permissions already.
I think cpw is drunk.
no, because there are already hardware companies.
that's the ubuntu-helping spirit! =D
what? This? A liberal democracy? Have you seen the government lately?!
right, that fits within my vague satire
it's definitely checkable. md5sum /dev/hdc
I had assumed he was using windows, just a hunch
yes, same as dapper is.
his claim is wrong, but apt-get is not the same as aptitude
no, apt-get is not the same as aptitude, but it works just as well. It's just not GUI. Different strokes...
apt-get is not gui, apt-get doesn't track dependencies, aptitude does
as in when you do aptitude remove, it removes all the dependencies it installed with it so that they don't float around on your disk uselessly

ah, yes, that's correct. However, what kitche was saying is that if you try to install a new program with apt-get, it won't fetch all the dependencies it needs and the program won't be runnable, which is BS and FUD.
yeah, that is why I said, he was wrong but that to say they are the same is wrong, even if they are essentially the same for his purpose
I never said they were the same! I said, and I quote: kitche: that's FUD. apt-get works just as well as aptitude.
I assure you I'm perfectly aware they're different programs.
I figured you did know they were different, just that you may be dumbing stuff down for a noob, which is never good

no, no, I never attempted to convey the impression that they were THE SAME, merely that if you apt-get install foobar, you will get foobar; and that if you aptitude install foobar, you will get foobar.
but the beta...
the blog I linked to says the beta will be out "soon".
